author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) are all met! ✅

Your new package registration met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

## 3. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. 

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
[noblock] Auto merge issues should be resolved. Let me know if further action needed on my end.
[noblock] You have to retrigger the registration and edit your comment to contain `[noblock]`

This package IMO falls into the "personal utility package" category:

> The General registry is not a place for "personal packages" that consist of collections of "utility functions"

[noblock] This seems totally fine to me. It was the result of a discussion at https://julialang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/137791-general/topic/Export.20everything.20from.20a.20module/near/465268373, so it already has the interest of more than the original author.
[noblock] A thread you were a part of, I just realized. So, you really find it objectionable to have this solution packaged up?

I was only part of the initial question, not of the follow up discussion. Still, in the followup discussion there was an [existing package](https://github.com/dalum/InlineExports.jl) pointed out which already does this (and is also registered), so I'm mostly questioning what this package does so differently that it couldn't be done with the existing one.

As it stands, this package is barely over ten LOC, and (to me at least) chiefly falls in the same kind of utility package category that things like `leftpad` would (which IIRC have been rejected from the registry for that reason in the past).

[noblock] It’s a valid point. So @BrianDouglasIE should make an argument for the package and try to convince @Seelengrab that this should be merged. Or, if no consensus can be reached, find a registry maintainer on Slack and convince them to merge manually

@Seelengrab obviously feels stronger about this than me. 

@goerz Happy for this to be closed.

body:
- Registering package: ExportUtils

- Version: v0.1.0

- Description: A package providing utilities to simplify Julia module exports.
title: New package: ExportUtils v0.1.0
